page.title: 12Another extract from 1945 2a
page.content:
NEWBRIDGE IN 1945 _________________ researched by Sarah probert
In the old bin bath on the cold stone floor in front of the fire,we didn't have a bathroom,and the toilet was at the bottom of the garden. I can remember my mother made all the children go out to play on a sunday afternoon,all except my brother John he was a lookout.A few of the men used to come to our house to play cards and do a bit of gambling,and John would sit in the road to keep a lookout,and if the policemen came up the street,he used to run and tell my mother,and the men would all escape through the back door,because gambling
